Food-1a

Food images from Mary-Ann: AN singular. Given together as a single row [and then if possible, highlight each image as it is read through].

Vocabulary Section 1

e's

clam

tmato's

tomato

tap'tan

potato

wen'ju'sugapun

turnip

enmapejit

carrot

'pse's's

onion

jijjawignej

raisin

gmu'jmin

raspberry

atuomgmin

strawberry

  • ←Previous Vocabulary
  • Next Vocabulary→

This lesson is a set of vocabulary words about a very useful subject: food! You will read and hear the words for each kind of food in the singular and plural forms (for example, how to say "potato" and how to say "potatoes"). Some words will become plural when you add a "-l" on the end, like "switis" (candy) becoming "switisl" (candies).* Some words will become plural when you add a "-g" on the end, like "tap'tan" (potato) becoming "tap'tang" (potatoes). * yes, "switis" probably comes from the English word "sweets" or "sweeties". You'll notice a few words in this section that sound fairly similar to English or French. Why do you think that might be the case?
